description:
International Features Editor, The BMJ
Journalism lecturer, Imperial College London
Japanophile, #MUFC. Views mine

Astrophysicist at Imperial College London. Works with space missions like Herschel and Planck, on extragalactic astronomy, observational cosmology and astrobiology. Ask about phosphine on Venus! Also writes science fiction. Not speaking for anybody
Australian expat neuron wrangler. Professor of Neurotechnology at Imperial College London. Investigates memory and cognition with photons. Runs and rides bikes a lot.

Climate sciences research fellow at Imperial College London. UK poetry slam champion 2019.
https://linktr.ee/rlamboll
The pop-punk herpetologist 🤘 | Anglia Ruskin, Imperial College London, and University of Kent alumnus | Lover of all amphibians and reptiles | First Gen in STEM | Herpetologist
Professor of Electrical Power Engineering at Imperial College London and Academic Lead for Sustainability. All the drivel that follows is my own personal view.
Synthetic Biology & Synthetic Genomics @ Imperial College London and the Sanger Institute. Bilingual in English and DNA. Views are either my own or my microbes'

Thinking about the brain, spinal cord and how we move (and related neurotech). Into books, music, coffee, food, photography+art, animals & some humans. Group leader at Imperial College London

#neuroskyence #Sensorimotor #compneurosky #Science

Associate Professor (Senior Lecturer) of Developmental and Evolutionary Genomics at Imperial College London, Department of Life Sciences
https://marcotrizzino.wordpress.com/
Behavioural revolutionary ecology, quantitative genetics @Imperial College London.🪺🐦‍⬛🐓🐧🦚🍄, islands, hiking, running.
Research scholar at IIASA. Imperial College London. Contributing author IPCC AR6 WG3 (assessed temperatures of the scenarios). Climate, energy, economics, decent living standards, and justice.
Professor at Imperial College London and Principal Scientist at Google DeepMind. Tweeting in a personal capacity. To send me a message please use email

Innate immunity, bacterial infection, physiology, microbiology, Drosophila. Poorly focused. Still angry. Professor in Department of Life Sciences and Centre for Bacterial Resistance Biology, Imperial College London.
Lecturer in Science Communication, Imperial College London. Associate Fellow, Institute for Technology and Humanity, University of Cambridge. Books: AI Narratives, Imagining AI. 🇳🇱🇸🇷🏳️‍🌈
Cell cycle enthusiast at MRC LMS and Imperial College London

Lecturer Imperial College London
Microbiology Bacteriology Scientist Biofilm Bacteria Nature T6SS and bacterial competition
Researcher at Imperial College London • Historian • PhD in Military Medicine • Blast Injury • Chronic Pain • Applied History • Sometimes Cats, Movies & Spooky Things. And Pastries.
Bacterial pathogenesis. Antibiotic discovery. Membrane remodelling. Structural biology #cryoEM @Imperial College, London thelowlab.org
PI and Sir Henry Dale Research Fellow at Imperial College London and The Francis Crick Institute.

Immunologist working in biotech/translational 
science. PhD in zebrafish mucosal and respiratory immunology at Imperial College London.
Co-founder of Black In Immuno.
Scientist at Imperial College London, UK. Immunology, Zebrafish, Inflammation, transcriptomics, gut, lung, fibroblasts 3Rs 🏳️‍🌈🇪🇺She/her

Reader in Synthetic Biology at Imperial College London #synbio and evolution for health, the environment and the circular economy

Consultant in Metabolic Medicine

Imperial College London
